sentence.text: mitochondrion organization is an autosomal recessive generalized connective tissue disorder associated with extreme corneal thinning and a high risk of corneal rupture.

Some individuals with heterozygous negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II mutations demonstrate a carrier ocular phenotype, which includes a mildly reduced corneal thickness, keratoconus and blue sclera.

entity.text: negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II

sentence.text: We hypothesized that heterozygous variants in negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II and regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II predispose to the development of isolated keratoconus.

entity.text: negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II
regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II

sentence.text: We found a significant enrichment of potentially pathologic heterozygous alleles in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II associated with the development of keratoconus (P = 0.00102) resulting in a relative risk of 12.0.

entity.text: regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II

sentence.text: This enrichment of rare potentially pathogenic alleles in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II in 12.5% of keratoconus patients represents a significant mutational load and highlights ZNF469 as the most significant genetic factor responsible for keratoconus identified to date.

entity.text: regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II
